definition: to cater to sb to make them happy (esp. of one's parents)
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive

a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to live with one's parents, thus bringing them happiness (idiom)
father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
lord/master/young gentleman/male prostitute/catamite/mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes/(old form of address for one's husband) husband
to take loving care of/to value
(old) your servant (humble self-reference by young female)
